snippet: The news appeared on Saturday, when North Korea’s official news agency reported that the country’s leader, Kim Jong-un, had visited a newly built cemetery for an unspecified number of victims.
abstract: North and South Korean news media report that a North Korean naval vessel sank in October, killing an unspecified number of sailors; North Korea infers that downing was during military operations, but South Korea insists there was no military incident.
lead_paragraph: The news appeared on Saturday, when North Korea’s official news agency reported that the country’s leader, Kim Jong-un, had visited a newly built cemetery for an unspecified number of victims.

headline.main: North Korean Sailors Reported Killed in October Sinking; South Says There Was No Clash
headline.print_headline: North Korean Sailors Reported Killed in October Sinking; South Says There Was No Clash
